intro: Conopharyngia rutshuruensis, commonly known as the Rutshuru conopharyngia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Conopharyngiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiral-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
